summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs News Briefing from August 10, 2021, covering a wide range of national and international news. It includes a brief mention of Prince Andrew being sued by an Epstein accuser, alongside other major stories such as the Taliban advance in Afghanistan, COVID-19 developments, and domestic U.S. politics.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Sued by a woman who alleges she was trafficked by Jeffrey Epstein and that Prince Andrew sexually abused her about two decades ago.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: Filed a civil lawsuit against Prince Andrew, alleging he sexually assaulted and battered her when she was 17 and being trafficked by Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the deceased financier who allegedly trafficked the plaintiff, Virginia Giuffre, for sex.

connections.description: Giuffre alleges Prince Andrew sexually assaulted and battered her when she was a minor being trafficked by Jeffrey Epstein.
Giuffre states she was trafficked for sex by the late financier Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Prince Andrew Sued by Epstein Accuser
events.description: Virginia Giuffre files a civil lawsuit in U.S. court against Britain's Prince Andrew, alleging he sexually abused her about two decades ago when she was 17 and being trafficked by Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: Prince Andrew was sued in U.S. court on August 9, 2021, by Virginia Giuffre, an accuser of Jeffrey Epstein.
The lawsuit alleges Prince Andrew sexually assaulted and battered Giuffre when she was 17 years old.
The document is primarily an FBI news briefing covering a broad spectrum of news; the Epstein-related item is a single entry among many.
The briefing confirms the civil lawsuit was filed, but does not contain details from the complaint or legal arguments.
